reviews.sentence: Great location. Great hotel. Clean rooms good food pool tennis right in downtown.

Excellent location and service. We stayed at the Hilton Atlanta for 2 nights while visiting the Georgia Aquarium. Being on the executive level added to the experience. We were on the 26th floor with an excellent view of the city had breakfast and evening snacks included in the executive lounge along with free internet in the room. The rooms were well appointed and spacious. We used the self park option which was easy to do but I will say my husband had some difficulty finding the car when we were getting ready to leave. The fitness center was large and faced the pool. We were in walking distance of the aquarium and restaurants along with some other sights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely return.

It Was a Nice Stay But. This as a first business trip to Atlanta for a conference not the only one in town. The hotel is showing its age. The staff were great friendly attentive and helpful. I wish all my hotels had staff that good. The lobbies are huge multi story and provide a lot of smaller gathering points. However none are private and none are quiet. Our guest room would have been satisfactory except for the noise coming from both inside and out. We were on the side overlooking the pool and the thruway. Traffic noise was constant with the general interruption of motorcycles ambulances police and fire trucks. The corridors are very noisy and the doors tend to slam shut. Put a rolled up towel at the bottom of the door to help. For the bed my back still hurts. In a hotel of this cost I would have expected free WiFi. Not true. Even the internet hook up at 1295 per day was poor. All the net connections were slow or non existent. I could only consider this a fall back hotel. I selected average only since I have stayed in worse.

Business or Pleasure it is a Solid Choice. I just spent three nights here during the ASHRAE Summer Annual Meeting. This was my first time at this hotel. The food is a little pricey but it is what I would expect for downtown Atlanta. From a business standpoint it has everything you need in a business center it is an easy walk to many restaurants and bars it has multiple dining choices within the hotel the executive lounge is large and serves an excellent breakfast and nightly drink specials and there is plenty of meeting space. From a personal standpoint the rooms are large and clean the pool is nice the pool deck is huge there is a basketball court tennis courts and outdoor walking track and a very large anc complete fitness facility that overlooks the pool deck. Trader Vics is very good make sure to have a 151 Mai Tai and the rooftop bar and restaurant has some nice views. Self parking is 22 per day which I think is steep but again we are talking downtown Atlanta.

Good downtown option. I needed a hotel close to Americas Mart for business and this hotel is 2 blocks from the convention center. Indoor overhead walkways make it convenient to the MARTA and the Mart without having to go out in the heat or walk on the uneven and sometimes broken sidewalks uphill. The staff were all pleasant and the hotel has a pool restaurant bar and gift shop as expected. The air conditioning was very cold in the room. Set it to 68 but always felt warm. The nigtlight that is at the bottom of the nightstand was most annoying as it came on automatically upon movement. I would stay here again on business as it is convenient and the staff friendly.

1st stay in atlanta. The hotel was nice. Absolutely huge. We were welcomed from the time we got out of our car until we checked in. Room and parking were very reasonable compared to other hotels. Pool was clean and plenty of chairs were available. Lots of parking spaces were available as well. We were in walking distance to Peach Stretthe main street and had access to Americas Mart which was our reason for our visit.
Decent rooms some nice views pool and close to all the attractions.

Great place to stay. Close to downtown. Outdoor pool was great. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Elevators seemed slow. Pressed one button for 8 elevators but it took quite some time before one arivedsemed like they were nt all running at once.

Decent hotel but location not the best. Room was nice and pool. Shocking you charge a high rate for the room and then have to pay for wifi. Shame on you Hilton. The concierge gave us misinformation to how far it was to walk to an attraction and how to report a crime. Disappointing. Location not nice lots of homeless people around and if you wanted to go out on a night no where near nice to go without being approached for money several times.
My stay. Basketball court and pool.

Older but it works. Hilton Atlanta is currently undergoing renovations Dec 2016 that will update the lobby level all rooms and pool area. Compared to the Mariot Marquis just a short walk using the skybridge its outclassed in almost every regard. Mariot is also about double the price of the Hilton and the in hotel restaurants are also about double. Hilton offers a competitive priced hotel in downtown Atlanta that will not break the bank. Rooms are clean with flat screen TV along with fridge coffee. I travel a lot so Ironing is key and they provide both the ironing board along with the iron with the option of using their in house dry cleaning services. All in all if you are looking for a comfortable room at a competitive price point in downtown Atlanta Hilton Atlanta should fit the bill.

I would not stay there or recommended to any of my friends. It did not have a pool the price was high for a hotel under construction and the covers were so old. I was so disappointed. Old covers no pool. old old old need updates new painting the staff was great just the look of the hotel was a disaster.

great price for last minute reservations. location was great staff very nice. Construction in progress even non Sunday am. Pool closed basketball courts not light. None of these were made known when booking.

Not satisfied at all. Clean romNice staff. Construstion work at 7 am No pool false advertisingFor starters it say free public parking but that s not true at all you have to pay 30 and if there s no where to park in the garage you have to additional money to park down the street and which you have the pressure of walking back to the hotel. Free breakfast was advertised but not given.
location. no pool no free breakfast.
Lobby looks great after the remodel. Also all guest rooms now have refrigerators. Only downside to the remodel is the loss of the pool.

The room was super dusty when you turn on the AC you can see the dust flying every where and I have TERRIBLE allergies to dust mites I had to wipe the tables down along with the lamps. When I got here I did not realize why I kept sneezing so I took another allergy pill I did not realized it was the dust until night time when we used the lamp in between the beds and that is when I saw the dust flying every where. that is when I wiped everything down with baby wipes and clean our room SMH The garage was so confusing the website stated they have a pool and they DO NOT. Front desk people seem unsure if we can park where it said only for reserved will be towed away. we should her the signed and she said it was ok for us to park there which it WAS NOT. If you want to keep your customers have employees that knows the policies buildings And that actually CLEANS. I should not have to clean our own room YOU GUYS SHOULD pay me back since I can do a BETTER job at cleaning.

I will admit this was a very nice hotel. Their continental breakfast is very nice and the servers that were there were very nice. The reason I gave them this rating is because they neglected to inform us that the pool was closed for repair. When we made the reservation it should have been told that this was one of the amenities that would not be available we could have stayed somewhere else in the heart of hotlanta with a pool. And they only wanted to give us each we were a party of 4 a 20 voucher to one of the cheaper restaurants in the hotel. We refused that because we would be there for another four nights and still have no pool access. So they offered to give us each 50 back. So with that being said I will not stay there on any visit to Atlanta.

In the other side of the road the parking 20. very expensive Wifi. 6 per day for emails. If you want more speed the wifi will cost 15 The TV is expensive too. I just switch on the remote control of tv and the hotel try to charge 108 for movie. No pool in the hotel.
Great Hotel but lacking some things. We had a great stay but the traffic jam outside the driveway to check in was awful no pool And we wanted to cool off it was hot outside.
